definition: to turn one's head/to turn round/to turn about

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
suffix for nouns
to turn on one's heels/to walk away abruptly

sentences.english: Passengers had rebelled against the hijackers, who had turned the plane toward Washington.
sentences.chinese: 劫機者將飛機掉頭飛往華盛頓，乘客們奮起反抗。

sentences.english: After speaking, the official turned and left.
sentences.chinese: 說完，這位官員立刻掉頭就走了。

sentences.english: Struggle through the thought, he still turns around come home.
sentences.chinese: 經過思想鬥爭，他還是掉頭回家。

sentences.english: The wind bit with a sharper edge and I turned toward my home.
sentences.chinese: 風颳如刀割，我開始掉頭回家。

sentences.english: Suddenly  he stopped  and  turned  around  and headed back.
sentences.chinese: 突然，他猛一剎車掉頭往回就跑。

sentences.english: It's also a wisdom to turn back when one can't cross a river.
sentences.chinese: 過不了的河掉頭而回，也是一種智慧。

sentences.english: Giff leaves, not doubling back this time.
sentences.chinese: 吉夫掉頭走了，這次沒再回來。

sentences.english: The group turned and began riding across the land.
sentences.chinese: 那組生物掉頭沿着陸地出發了。

sentences.english: Using a mirror, check your head for hair loss.
sentences.chinese: 照一下鏡子，看下你的頭上有沒有掉頭髮。

sentences.english: A COUPLE of years ago my hair started falling out.
You both have to reverse, costing you time and money.
sentences.chinese: 你們都必須掉頭，損失了時間和金錢。

sentences.english: So together, Kreiger and Agonistes turned round and headed into the desert.
sentences.chinese: 然後，克里奇和阿岡尼司帝斯一起掉頭朝着沙漠走去。

sentences.english: Before you stop or turn around,make sure your path is clear.
sentences.chinese: 在你停下來或者掉頭之前，確保你的路線是清楚的。

sentences.english: Katie turned the wheel and they headed back down the road.
sentences.chinese: 卡蒂打回輪兒，她們掉頭沿路開回去。

sentences.english: I'd buy you Rogaine if you start losing all your hair.
sentences.chinese: 我將買下你下面的部分如果你開始掉頭髮了。

sentences.english: As soon as the employer ask for money, you can go without hovering.
sentences.chinese: 只要用人單位一說要你交錢，你掉頭就走便是了。

definition: to gallop/speedily/to proceed to/to pilot (ship, plane etc)/to sail
(of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
less advanced/underdeveloped/lagging behind/the younger generation/the less experienced ones
car or other vehicle (bicycle, truck etc)
to dash (run fast)/to rush/to dart
to follow
at once/right away/immediately/on horseback (i.e. by military force)
soon after
pass/gateway/(fig.) juncture
elevator/escalator/CL:臺|台[tai2],部[bu4]
immediately/presently/following which
at once/immediately/promptly/swiftly
next/later/after that
to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
to take advantage/to seize an opportunity/in passing/without taking extra trouble/conveniently
to get on or into (a bus, train, car etc)
